(onboard [[American Airlines Flight 11|AA Flight 11]]) [[computer programmer]] Colonel, USAF [[List of astronauts by selection#1982|1982 USAF Group]] None ColonelCharles Edward("Chuck")Jones(November 4, 1952 – September 11, 2001) was a United States Air Force officer, acomputer programmer, and an astronaut in the USAFManned Spaceflight Engineer Program.
article.heading: Biography
article.paragraph: File:12.6.11CharlesEdwardJonesPanelN-74ByLuigiNovi1.jpgthumbleftJones' name is located on Panel N-74 of theNational September 11 Memorials North Pool, along with those of other passengers of Flight 11.Jones was born inClinton, IndianaClinton,Indiana. He graduated fromWichita High School Eastin 1970 and earned a bachelor of science in astronautical engineering from theUnited States Air Force Academyin 1974. He entered the USAF Manned Spaceflight Engineer program in 1982, and was scheduled to fly on missionCancelled Shuttle missionsSTS-71-Bin December 1986, but the mission was cancelled after theSpace Shuttle Challenger''Challenger'' Disasterin January 1986. He left the Manned Spaceflight Engineer program in 1987.

He was killed at the age of 48 in theSeptember 11, 2001 attacksattacks of September 11, 2001, aboardAmerican Airlines Flight 11. He had been living as a retiredUS Air ForceColonel inBedford, MassachusettsBedford,Massachusetts, at the time of his death. He was survived by his wife Jeanette.
At theNational 9/11 Memorial, Jones is memorialized at the North Pool, on Panel N-74.Charles Edward Jones. Memorial Guide:National 9/11 Memorial. Retrieved December 11, 2011.-
